com.stormpath.sdk.impl.account

Class DefaultCreateAccountRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.sdk.impl.account.DefaultCreateAccountRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CreateAccountRequest

    public class DefaultCreateAccountRequest
extends Object
implements CreateAccountRequest
    Since:
    0.9

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DefaultCreateAccountRequest(Account account, Boolean registrationWorkflowEnabled, AccountOptions options) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Account getAccount()
      Returns the Account instance for which a new record will be created in Stormpath.
      AccountOptions getAccountOptions()
      Returns the AccountOptions to be used in the CreateAccountRequest s to retrieve the account's references as part of Stormpath's response upon successful account creation.
      PasswordFormat getPasswordFormat()
      Returns the passwordFormat denoting the format of the password.
      boolean isAccountOptionsSpecified()
      Returns true if the the request reflects that the CreateAccount (POST) message will be send with URL query parameters to retrieve the account's references as part of Stormpath's response upon successful account creation.
      boolean isPasswordFormatSpecified()
      Returns true if the password of this request is not a raw password but a formatted password hash instead.
      boolean isRegistrationWorkflowEnabled()
      Returns true if the backing directory's registration workflow must execute, false if the backing directory's registration workflow must not execute.
      boolean isRegistrationWorkflowOptionSpecified()
      Returns true if the the request reflects that the backing directory's registration workflow should be explicitly enabled or disabled, false if the request should reflect the backing directory's default behavior.
      CreateAccountRequest setPasswordFormat(PasswordFormat passwordFormat) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • isRegistrationWorkflowOptionSpecified

        public boolean isRegistrationWorkflowOptionSpecified()
        Description copied from interface: CreateAccountRequest
        Returns true if the the request reflects that the backing directory's registration workflow should be explicitly enabled or disabled, false if the request should reflect the backing directory's default behavior.

        You should always invoke this method to see if it is safe to invoke the CreateAccountRequest.isRegistrationWorkflowEnabled() method.

        Specified by:
        isRegistrationWorkflowOptionSpecified in interface CreateAccountRequest
        Returns:
        true if the the request reflects that the backing directory's registration workflow should be explicitly enabled or disabled, false if the request should reflect the backing directory's default behavior.

      • isPasswordFormatSpecified

        public boolean isPasswordFormatSpecified()
        Description copied from interface: CreateAccountRequest
        Returns true if the password of this request is not a raw password but a formatted password hash instead. Please read more info about the supported formats here.
        Specified by:
        isPasswordFormatSpecified in interface CreateAccountRequest
        Returns:
        true if the request reflects that the CreateAccount (POST) message will be sent with a URL query parameter to specify the account has a password in a specific format to be imported.

      • setPasswordFormat

        Description copied from interface: CreateAccountRequest
        Returns the passwordFormat denoting the format of the password. Please read more info about the supported formats here

      • isRegistrationWorkflowEnabled

        public boolean isRegistrationWorkflowEnabled()
                                      throws IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: CreateAccountRequest
        Returns true if the backing directory's registration workflow must execute, false if the backing directory's registration workflow must not execute. This value explicitly overrides whatever the directory might have as a default.

        Always call the CreateAccountRequest.isRegistrationWorkflowOptionSpecified() method first to see if this value has been configured. Attempting to call this method when it has not been configured will result in an IllegalStateException

        Specified by:
        isRegistrationWorkflowEnabled in interface CreateAccountRequest
        Returns:
        true if the backing directory's registration workflow must execute, false if the backing directory's registration workflow must not execute.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this method is called but CreateAccountRequest.isRegistrationWorkflowOptionSpecified() is false.

      • isAccountOptionsSpecified

        public boolean isAccountOptionsSpecified()
        Description copied from interface: CreateAccountRequest
        Returns true if the the request reflects that the CreateAccount (POST) message will be send with URL query parameters to retrieve the account's references as part of Stormpath's response upon successful account creation.

        You should always invoke this method to see if it is safe to invoke the CreateAccountRequest.getAccountOptions() method.

        Specified by:
        isAccountOptionsSpecified in interface CreateAccountRequest
        Returns:
        true if the the request reflects that the CreateAccount (POST) message will be send with URL query parameters to retrieve the expanded references in the Stormpath's response upon successful account creation.

      • getAccountOptions

        public AccountOptions getAccountOptions()
        Description copied from interface: CreateAccountRequest
        Returns the AccountOptions to be used in the CreateAccountRequest s to retrieve the account's references as part of Stormpath's response upon successful account creation.

        Always call the CreateAccountRequest.isAccountOptionsSpecified() method first to see if this value has been configured. Attempting to call this method when it has not been configured will result in an IllegalStateException

        Specified by:
        getAccountOptions in interface CreateAccountRequest
        Returns:
        AccountOptions to be used in the CreateAccountRequest s to retrieve the account's references as part of Stormpath's response upon successful account creation.
